intro: Chatinia auriculata, commonly known as the auriculate chatinia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive auriculate (ear-shaped) leaves and showy, pentagonal flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
